ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DATA=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies the SAS data set containing the data to be analyzed. If you omit
the DATA= option, the procedure uses the most recently created SAS data set.

Reverses the sorting order of the classification variable (specified in the CLASS 
statement). If both the DESCENDING and ORDER=  options are specified, PROC GAM 
orders the categories according to the ORDER= option and then reverses that order.

Specifies the sorting order for the levels of all classification variables (specified in the CLASS statement). 
This ordering determines which parameters in the model correspond to each level in the data.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Levels sorted by the order of appearance in the input data set.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Levels sorted by the external formatted value, except for numeric variables with no explicit  format, which are sorted by their unformatted (internal) value.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Levels sorted by the descending frequency count; levels with the most observations come first  in the order.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Levels sorted by the unformatted value.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Controls the plots produced through ODS Graphics.
      
Syntax: 
(1) PLOTS <(global-plot-options)> = plot-request <(options)> 
(2) PLOTS <(global-plot-options)> = (plot-request <(options)> <...plot-request <(options)> > )

The global-plot-options apply to all plots generated by the GAM procedure, unless altered by a
specific-plot-option. 

UNPACK 
specifies that multiple smoothing component plots that are collected into graphics panels be
displayed separately. Use this option if you want to access individual smoothing component 
plots within the panel. 

The following listing describes the specific plots and their options.

  ALL 
  requests that all plots are produced. 

  NONE 
  suppresses all plots. 

  COMPONENTS | COMPONENT <(components-options)> 
  requests the SmoothingComponentPlot that displays a panel of smoothing component plots. The following
  components-options are available: 

      ADDITIVE 
      requests that the additive component plots are produced for spline effects. The additive component
      plots combine the linear trend and the nonparametric prediction for each spline effect if its linear
      part is not specified explicitly in the MODEL statement. 

      CLM 
      includes confidence limits in the smoothing component plots. By default, 95% confidence limits are
      produced, but you can change the significance level by specifying the ALPHA=  option in the MODEL
      statement. Note that producing these limits can be computationally intensive for large data sets. 

      COMMONAXES 
      specifies that smoothing component plots use a common vertical axis. This enables you to visually
      judge relative effect size. 

      UNPACK 
      specifies that the smoothing components be displayed individually.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Requests the SmoothingComponentPlot that displays a panel of smoothing component plots.                                 Syntax: COMPONENTS<(components-options)>  The following components-options are available:         ADDITIVE        requests that the additive component plots are produced for spline effects.         CLM        includes confidence limits in the smoothing component plots.         COMMONAXES        specifies that smoothing component plots use a common vertical axis.         UNPACK        specifies that the smoothing components be displayed individually.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Reverses the sorting order of the classification variable.

[Syntax: TRUNCATE<=n>] 
          
Specifies the length n of CLASS variable values to use in determining CLASS variable 
levels. If you specify TRUNCATE without the length n, the first 16 characters of the 
formatted values are used.
Specifies the sorting order for the categories of categorical variables.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Levels sorted by the order of appearance in the input data set.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Levels sorted by the external formatted value, except for numeric variables with no explicit  format, which are sorted by their unformatted (internal) value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Levels sorted by the descending frequency count; levels with the most observations come first  in the order.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Levels sorted by the unformatted value.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: BY <DESCENDING> variable-1 <...<DESCENDING> variable-n> <NOTSORTED>; 
      
You can specify a BY statement with PROC GAM to obtain separate analyses on observations 
in groups that are defined by the BY variables. When a BY statement appears, the procedure 
expects the input data set to be sorted in order of the BY variables. If you specify more 
than one BY statement, only the last one specified is used.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that 
immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.
Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: FREQ variable;
      
The FREQ statement names a variable that provides frequencies for each observation in the DATA=
data set. Specifically, if n is the value of the FREQ variable for a given observation, then that
observation is used n times.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Reverses the order of the response categories. If both the DESCENDING and ORDER= 
options are specified, PROC GAM orders the response categories according to the 
ORDER= option and then reverses that order.

Syntax: EVENT=‘category’|keyword
          
Specifies the event category for the binary response model. PROC GAM models the probability of the
event category.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Event category for the binary response model
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Designates the first ordered category as the event.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Designates the last ordered category as the event.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ALPHA=number] 
          
Specifies the significance level, α, of the confidence limits on the final nonparametric 
component estimates when you request confidence limits to be included in the output data
set. Specify number as a value between 0 and 1. The default value is 0.05.
Specifies the type of method to be used to produce the "Analysis of Deviance" table for smoothing effects.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that PROC GAM perform χ² tests by fitting nested GAM models.  This is the default choice if you do not specify the ANODEV=  option.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that PROC GAM perform approximate tests of smoothing effects.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Requests that the procedure not produce the 'Analysis of Deviance' table for smoothing effects.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies the distribution family used in the model.

[Syntax: EPSILON=number] 
          
Specifies the convergence criterion for the backfitting algorithm. The default 
value is 1E-8.

[Syntax: EPSSCORE=number] 
          
Specifies the convergence criterion for the local scoring algorithm. The default 
value is 1E-8.

Produces an iteration summary table for the smoothing effects when doing backfitting 
and local scoring.

[Syntax: MAXITER=number] 
          
Specifies the maximum number of iterations for the backfitting algorithm. The default 
value is 50.

[Syntax: MAXITSCORE=number] 
          
Specifies the maximum number of iterations for the local scoring algorithm.  The 
default value is 100.

Specifies that the value of the smoothing parameter should be selected by generalized 
cross validation. If you specify both METHOD=GCV and the DF= option for the smoothing 
effects, the user-specified DF is used, and the METHOD=GCV option is ignored.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the value of the smoothing parameter should be selected by generalized  cross validation.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies the sorting order for the categories of categorical variables.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Levels sorted by the order of appearance in the input data set.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Levels sorted by the external formatted value, except for numeric variables with no explicit  format, which are sorted by their unformatted (internal) value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Levels sorted by the descending frequency count; levels with the most observations come first  in the order.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Levels sorted by the unformatted value.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DATA=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies an input SAS data set containing all the variables included in independent 
effects in the MODEL statement.

[Syntax: OUT=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies the name of the SAS data set to contain the predictions.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: OUTPUT OUT=SAS-data-set < keyword <=prefix> ...keyword <=prefix>> ; 
      
The OUTPUT statement creates a new SAS data set containing diagnostic measures calculated after 
fitting the model. All the variables in the original data set are included in the new data set, 
along with the variables created by specifying keywords in the OUTPUT statement.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: OUT=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies the name of the new data set to contain the diagnostic measures. This specification 
is required.
Predicted values for each smoothing component and overall predicted values on the response scale at design points.
Linear prediction values on the link scale at design points.
Upper confidence limits for each predicted smoothing component.
Lower confidence limits for each predicted smoothing component.
Diagonal element of the hat matrix associated with the observation for each smoothing spline component.
Residual standardized by its weights.
Standard deviation of the prediction for each smoothing component.
All statistics in this list.
